intro: Psychotria montana var. gracillima, commonly known as the slender psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to parts of Central and South America, particularly in regions with humid tropical climates. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. Its flowers are typically white or pale green, with five petals and a prominent yellow or orange calyx. This species is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and undergrowth.
